section.title: Laws of Matrix Algebra
section.p: The following is a summary of the basic laws of matrix operations. Assume that the indicated operations are defined; that is, that the orders of the matrices A, B and C are such that the operations make sense.

row.cell: Distrutive Law of a Scalar over Matrices
\(c(A + B) = c A + c B\), where \(c \in \mathbb{R}\).
Distrutive Law of Scalars over a Matrix
\(0 A =\pmb{0}\), where 0 on the left is the scalar zero.
Zero Matrix is an identity for Addition
Right Distrutive Law of Matrix Multiplication
Left Distrutive Law of Matrix Multiplication
Identity Matrix is a Multiplicative Identity

example.title: More Precise Statement of one Law

statement.p: If we wished to write out each of the above laws more completely, we would specify the orders of the matrices. For example, Law 10 should read:

blockquote.p: Let A, B, and C be \(m\times n\), \(n\times p\), and \(n\times p\) matrices, respectively, then \(A(B + C) = A B + A C\)

li.p: Notice the absence of the law \(A B = B A\). Why? It is missing because it isn't true!
Is it really necessary to have both a right (No. 11) and a left (No. 10) distributive law? Why?Yes, because matrix multiplication is not commutative.

exercise.statement: Rewrite the above laws specifying as in the orders of the matrices.
Verify each of the Laws of Matrix Algebra using examples.

Let \(A = \left( \begin{array}{cc} 1 & 2 \\ 0 & -1 \\ \end{array} \right)\), \(B= \left( \begin{array}{ccc} 3 & 7 & 6 \\ 2 & -1 & 5 \\ \end{array} \right)\), and \(C= \left( \begin{array}{ccc} 0 & -2 & 4 \\ 7 & 1 & 1 \\ \end{array} \right)\). Compute the following as efficiently as possible by using any of the Laws of Matrix Algebra:
\(A B + A C\)
\(A^{-1}\)
\(A(B + C)\)
\(\left(A^2\right)^{-1}\)
\((C + B)^{-1}A^{-1}\)

Let \(A =\left( \begin{array}{cc} 7 & 4 \\ 2 & 1 \\ \end{array} \right)\) and \(B =\left( \begin{array}{cc} 3 & 5 \\ 2 & 4 \\ \end{array} \right)\). Compute the following as efficiently as possible by using any of the Laws of Matrix Algebra:
\(A B\)
\(A + B\)
\(A^2 + A B + B A + B ^2\)
\(B^{-1}A^{-1}\)
\(A^2 + A B\)
Let A and B be \(n\times n\) matrices of real numbers. Is \(A^2-B^2= (A-B)(A+B) \unicode{0008}\)? Explain
